DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to denote a 15 centimeter position of a scanner bed in an axial position to an individual in the scanner.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most recent act of checking or adjusting (by comparison with a standard) the accuracy of a digital Positron Emission Tomography (PET) device._Position; the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Scanner Device Component
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
An electronic device that generates a digital representation of an image for data input to a computer or a receiver designed to search for a signal within a specified frequency range.

Property.preferredDefinition: Position; the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.

Concepts.definition: Position; the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 12/28/07- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number of a particular portion of space occupied in each PET image._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::15: A designated location of the bed as it is moved through the scanner for purposes of positioning a desired part of the subject in the field of view.
